Sequence Information.Peptide Name: AamAP2  (A. amoreuxi Antimicrobial Peptide 2, natural AMPs; scorpions, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: venom, the North African scorpion,Androctonus amoreuxi

Literature Information.Literature: C-terminally amidated (XXA).Activity: Active against S. aureus (MIC 48 uM) and C. albicans ( MIC 64 uM), and poorly active against E.coli (MIC 120 uM).Toxicity:  It caused ~50% hemolysis at 100 uM. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Almaaytah A1, Zhou M, Wang L, Chen T, Walker B, Shaw C.2012
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial/cytolytic peptides from the venom of the North African scorpion, Androctonus amoreuxi: biochemical and functional characterization of natural peptides and a single site-substituted analog.
